"Wormholes, Time Travel & UFOs: Is Humanity's Future Our Past?" on @Spreaker #advancedtechnology #ancientastronauttheory #antigravity #chileufo #conspiracytheories #cosmicmysteries #einsteinrosenbridge #exoticmatter #extraterrestrials #fringescience #futurehumans #nikolatesla

external.description:
Ever stared at the stars and wondered if the universe holds secrets far stranger than fiction? 🤯 Get ready to have your mind bent and your perceptions shattered! Our latest episode plunges into the exhilarating, often controversial, world of Fringe Science and Ancient Astronaut Theories, exploring the mind-bending possibilities of Wormholes, Time Travel, and chilling UFO Encounters!

We navigate the cosmic highways, dissecting scientific concepts like the Einstein-Rosen Bridge and the elusive exotic matter required for traversable wormholes, even speculating if these cosmic shortcuts were forged during the Big Bang itself. But the cosmos holds more than just theoretical physics.

We then investigate high-profile UFO incidents – from the baffling lights of Rendlesham Forest to the undeniable aerial phenomena over Chile. Prepare for a paradigm shift as we present the controversial idea: what if these extraterrestrials aren't just aliens, but us – time travelers from humanity's own future?

Finally, we journey back to Earth, examining the incredible life and visionary inventions of Nikola Tesla. Could his revolutionary insights into wireless power and anti-gravity have come from an otherworldly source? Was Tesla channeling information from beyond our time or dimension?

If you're captivated by unexplained phenomena, cosmic mysteries, conspiracy theories, and the potential for advanced technology to defy all known laws, this episode is your ultimate journey into the unknown. Prepare for a thrilling ride that will make you question everything you thought you knew about time, space, and our place in the universe.

Don't just wonder—listen now to unlock the secrets of wormholes, time travelers, and Tesla's cosmic connection! Share this mind-bending episode with fellow explorers of the impossible!
external.title: Wormholes, Time Travel & UFOs: Is Humanity's Future Our Past?

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Hunt for PLANET 9: Is a Super-Earth HIDING in the Dark?" on @Spreaker #astronomy #astrophysics #cosmos #gravity #hiddenplanet #kuiperbelt #mikebrown #mystery #nasa #planet9 #planetx #pluto #scicomm #sciencefacts #solarsystem #space #spaceexploration #spacenews #superearth

external.description:
Is there a massive, invisible ghost haunting the edge of our solar system? 🪐👻

For decades, we thought we had the solar system mapped out. But something strange is happening in the dark. Deep in the Kuiper Belt, far beyond Pluto, clusters of icy objects are moving in sync—as if they are being pulled by a giant, unseen hand.

In this episode, we join the high-stakes hunt for Planet Nine (often called Planet X). We break down the groundbreaking research by astronomers Mike Brown and Konstantin Batygin, who argue that a "Super-Earth"—ten times the mass of our home—is hiding in the shadows, shaping the orbits of our solar neighborhood.

But if it’s so big, why haven't we seen it?

We dive into the science of gravitational perturbations (the same method used to discover Neptune) and analyze why recent "candidate" detections from IRAS and AKARI satellite data might just be false alarms. We also separate the science from the fiction, debunking the Nibiru doomsday myths to show you what a real planetary discovery looks like.

Is this the scientific discovery of the century, or a mathematical illusion?

🎧 Listen now to join the search for the missing world that could rewrite our cosmic history.

Topics Covered: Planet Nine, Planet X, The Kuiper Belt, Mike Brown, Solar System Anomalies, Gravity, Nibiru vs. Science, Space Mysteries, Super-Earths.

[Ready to explore the unknown? Hit that subscribe button and share this episode with a fellow space nerd!]
external.title: The Hunt for PLANET 9: Is a Super-Earth HIDING in the Dark?

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "When AI SNAPS: 2025 Humanoid Robot FAILS & The Safety Crisis" on @Spreaker #ai #artificialintelligence #automation #chinatech #cyberpunk #engineering #failcompilation #futuretech #humanoidrobots #innovation #machinelearning #robotglitch #robotics #safetyfirst #scarytech

external.description:
Would you trust a 200lb metal machine to hold your baby? 🤖

In 2025, the promise of Humanoid Robots entering our homes is finally here—but so are the glitches. And these aren't just software bugs; they are bone-crushing hardware failures.

In this episode, we break down the viral wave of AI Robot Malfunctions that the tech companies don't want you to panic about. From the shocking footage of robots violently "snapping" mid-test due to torque spikes, to the humiliating crash of a Russian droid during its public debut, we cover the good, the bad, and the terrifying.

We also investigate the specific incident involving a G1 Robot and a sensor blind spot that crushed a child's shoe, raising a massive question: Are these machines actually safe for consumer release?

We dive deep into:

- The "Glitch" Reality: Why experts say this isn't a "Robotic Uprising," but a much scarier issue of unstable code meeting high-speed metal.
- The Racing Incident: What happens when a robot running at full speed slams into a human official?
- The China Factor: While the West struggles with safety, how is China successfully rolling out mass commercial units in factories right now?


If you are planning to buy a robot helper, or just want to know if you should be afraid of the future, you can't afford to skip this.

🎧 Hit Play to separate the sci-fi fear from the very real safety facts.
external.title: When AI SNAPS: 2025 Humanoid Robot FAILS & The Safety Crisis

record.bridgyOriginalText:
Since this seems to come up a lot, especially now with Windows being replaced by Copilot and Tim Apple being a frequent guest at the White House, I thought I'd write up my quick and objective guide to choosing Linux distros:

I just want something stable and easy to install that's still being maintained next century: Fedora.

I want a carefully hand crafted desktop experience curated for me by people who know what they're doing: KaOS.

I want to carefully hand craft my own desktop experience from scratch, I don't care how many wikis I have to read: Arch.

I think I'm somewhere in between those two extremes: Manjaro.

I'm a gamer: Bazzite.

I'm a Mac: Elementary.

I'm a Haskell weenie: NixOS.

I think rms made some good points: Debian.

I think Tommy Robinson made some good points: Omarchy.

I like South African billionaires: Ubuntu.

external.title: Original post on social.treehouse.systems

The "Agentic OS" is so half-assed.  The Copilot voice thingies for Windows even more so. 

If you want something like it, don't graft this lobotomized digital ghost to Windows. Revive something like a PDA you can talk to and instruct instead of whatever it is Microsoft is doing.

CoD 4 had the perfect balance!

The good news: it’ll be available direct and through CSP, so MSPs can actually package this into readiness and adoption work.

record.text: At AI's current level of capability, none of these companies are trusting AI with high-risk automated config changes. Today's outage appears to be caused by a file that got too big. There's still plenty of ways for humans to mess things up!
ひとやすみしたらパッソつけるぞ💻

ちょっと試しに、chatGPTくんに以前かいた風呂谷のSSと表紙絵を渡して、「このコンテンツから読み解くに、こいつはどういう奴よ？」と尋ねてみたら、こんな答えが返ってきてワロスしている。

＿人人人人人人人人人＿
＞　自己評価の低さ　＜
￣Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^￣
ただいモイ〜('Δ')♪
I don't see how you would pass the oral exams without knowledge. You also can't use ChatGPT there
Dass Diskriminierung von EU-Bürgern verboten ist, interessiert doch in Österreich sowieso niemand in allen Bereichen...
Das stimmt, trotzdem ist die DB zur Vermittlung nicht verpflichtet sondern entscheidet sich aktiv dafür
No vull ser jo la pureta del ChatGPT, però en 5 dies que he passat a la UAB TOTS els estudiants que he vist amb ordinador l'estaven consultant i em sembla una mica preocupant.
(Després cau un servidor arbitrari durant 6 hores, es paralitza el país i tot són plors...!)

Per mi és qüestió de gust personal, però encara existeix la gent que NO té smartphone o internet al mòbil. Estic fins la fava de zones blaves que es paguen amb el mòbil, carnets en versió digital... Paguen ells dades i telèfon nou cada cop que deixa de ser compatible amb versions anteiors d'Android?

value.text:
Avui estava agafant uns llibres a la biblioteca de la UAB, m'he adonat que el carnet estava caducat i quan li he preguntat a la noia com renovar-lo em diu: "bé, és que ara ja no en fan. Ara tenen una app".

Que em fiquin en un museu, ja.

record.text: Estoy tan cansada que un cliente nos envié soluciones del chatgpt... Hoy tenían un problema de servidores y en vez de reclamarlo a la gente que los lleva, nos dice que le preguntará al chagpt para un procedimiento mas estable y no tener mas problemas la próxima vez... Mátame camión
Yo estoy así JAJAJAJAJA con guantes de estos sin dedos programando en casa

record.text:
Skupinové chaty v ChatGPT s AI sú oddnes dostupné pre všetkých

V skratke: Pilot v Ázii uspel, funkcia skupinových konverzácií sa preto rozširuje globálne pre všetkých prihlásených používateľov. Do jednej skupiny môžete pozvať až 20 ľudí, pričom odpovede inteligentne generuje model ChatGPT 5.1…

external.description: V skratke: Pilot v Ázii uspel, funkcia skupinových konverzácií sa preto rozširuje globálne pre všetkých prihlásených používateľov. Do jednej skupiny môžete pozvať až 20 ľudí, pričom odpovede inteligentne generuje model ChatGPT 5.1 Auto. Limity správ sa uplatňujú iba na odpovede umelej inteligencie, chatovanie medzi ľuďmi je úplne neobmedzené. Po úspešnom pilotnom teste v Ázii prichádza veľká aktualizácia. OpenAI oficiálne sprístupňuje skupinové chaty v ChatGPT pre používateľov po celom svete. Spolupracujte až s 20 ľuďmi v jednom vlákne a využívajte najnovší inteligentný model 5.1 Auto. Spoločnosť OpenAI dnes, 21. novembra 2025, oznámila významný míľnik vo vývoji svojho chatbota.
external.title: Skupinové chaty v ChatGPT s AI sú oddnes dostupné pre všetkých

Širokouhlý fotoaparát dostane masívny 50 Mpx senzor veľkosti 1/1.28", čo je rekord v triede. výkon sa postará procesor Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 doplnený o pokročilý čip na spracovanie obrazu. Po nedávnom debute série X300 netrpezlivo čakáme na vrcholný model Ultra. Najnovšie úniky naznačujú, že Vivo X300 Ultra prepíše pravidlá mobilnej fotografie vďaka dvom 200 Mpx senzorom a revolučnej technológii spracovania obrazu, ktorá má prísť budúci rok. record.text:
Samsung Galaxy Glasses: Konkurent Meta Ray-Ban dostane vlastné pripojenie a fotochromatické sklá

V skratke: Nový model SM-O200P potvrdzuje formát ľahkých okuliarov, ktoré doplnia nedávno predstavený Galaxy XR headset. Zariadenie ponúkne fotoaparát, Wi-Fi a na rozdiel od konkurenčných Ray-Ban Meta…

external.description: V skratke: Nový model SM-O200P potvrdzuje formát ľahkých okuliarov, ktoré doplnia nedávno predstavený Galaxy XR headset. Zariadenie ponúkne fotoaparát, Wi-Fi a na rozdiel od konkurenčných Ray-Ban Meta aj nezávislé mobilné dáta. Očakáva sa nasadenie fotochromatických skiel Transitions a postupné uvedenie verzie bez displeja v roku 2026. Po tom, čo Samsung minulý mesiac odhalil svoj headset Galaxy XR, sa pozornosť technologického sveta presúva na ďalší produkt v sérii. Úniky potvrdzujú prípravu inteligentných okuliarov Galaxy Glasses, ktoré majú ambíciu prekonať populárne riešenie od spoločnosti Meta vďaka lepšej konektivite a pokročilej optike.

Poe AI在繁體中文上的表現如何？

在繁體中文的本地化測試中，Poe AI展現穩健且貼近在地語感的能力。台灣用戶反饋顯示，其繁體字、同義詞與專業術語的選擇更符合本地閱讀習慣，錯誤率下降、回覆更連貫。企業在客服、內容審核與教育輔助等場景的使用與滿意度提高，顯示長期價值。綜觀台灣市場，Poe AI具備高實用性與競爭力，值得投入。對於需要本地化語氣與法規遵循的企業尤為適用。

如何搶先體驗Claude的最新模型？

想要搶先體驗 Claude 最新模型？在台灣，官方通常優先給企業與研究機構，個人申請較慢。先明確在地智慧製造、金融、教育等場景，規劃數據治理與合規流程，加入官方等候名單，或透過本地雲端與研究機構合作申請。審核通過即可取得 API 金鑰、專家諮詢與在地化支援，誰先準備，誰就先得到先機。此外，參與由政府與學研單位協辦的培訓與案例分享，也能快速熟悉介面與合規要點，提升成功率。

**В Якутске решили отказаться от праздничного новогоднего салюта, сообщает ТАСС со ссылкой на администрацию города.**

«В этом году в Якутске не будет праздничного новогоднего салюта», — сообщили **ТАСС** в пресс-службе мэрии.

При этом жителям не запрещают запускать фейерверки в специально отведенных для этого местах.

Традиционный фейерверк в новогоднюю ночь в Якутске не проводится с 2022 года.

Ранее в пресс-службе регионального правительства сообщали, что органы государственной власти и местного самоуправления в Якутии отказались от праздничных корпоративов.

record.text:
Top 10 Crypto Airdrops of 2025 Airdrops have evolved from basic giveaways into a powerful user-acquisition strategy, giving new blockchain projects a way to spark traction from the very beginning. ...

#Crypto #blockchain

Origin | Interest | Match

external.description:
Table of Contents

Toggle

  * A Snapshot of 10 Notable Crypto Airdrops
    * 1. Berachain (BERA)
    * 2. Kaito AI (KAITO)
    * 3. Story Protocol (IP)
    * 4. Solayer Labs (LAYER)
    * 5. Plume Network (PLUME)
    * 6. Buzzeum (BUZZ)
    * 7. Nillion Network (NIL)
    * 8. Initia (INIT)
    * 9. Kamino Finance (KMNO)
    * 10. BSquared Network (B2)
  * Summary



Airdrops have evolved far beyond their early reputation as basic giveaway campaigns. Today, they serve as powerful catalysts for user growth, helping new projects gain traction while giving everyday users a low-barrier entry into the crypto space. By completing straightforward actions — exploring a platform, testing new tools, or sharing updates online — participants can earn tokens that may appreciate significantly as the ecosystem develops.

For builders, airdrops offer a strategic way to spotlight their projects, incentivise early involvement, and cultivate a strong, engaged user base right from the start. For users, they provide an accessible first step into digital assets, where a small initial reward can sometimes turn into substantial value.

Below are ten notable cases where early airdrop participants saw their modest token allocations grow into impressive gains.

## A Snapshot of 10 Notable Crypto Airdrops

**Token**| **Reward**| **Eligibility**
---|---|---
**Berachain (BERA)**|
~$678.7 million total| Early users, content creators & community participants via profile access.
**Kaito AI (KAITO)**|  ~$200.4 million total| Holders of Genesis NFT, program participants & Binance BNB Earn users.
**Story Protocol (IP)**|  ~$190 million total| Early testers and active community contributors.
**Solayer Labs (LAYER)**|  ~$123.6 million total| DeFi users, especially those engaging with synthetic assets.
**Plume Network (PLUME)**|  ~$112 million total| Registered participants completing testnet tasks, faucets & referrals.
**BUZZEUM (BUZZ)**|  ~$55.6 million total| Complete social media tasks and participate in the BUZZEUM community to earn entry.
**Nillion Network (NIL)**|  ~$54.5 million total| Testnet participants, community contributors, developers; Binance Launchpool supporters.
**Initia (INIT)**|  ~$37.25 million total| Early platform contributors and testers.
**Kamino Finance (KMNO)**|  ~$26.49 million total| Solana-based Season 3 stakers.
**BSquared Network (B2)**|  ~$10.5 million total| Early builders and contributors.

### **1. Berachain (BERA)**

Berachain’s airdrop stood out as one of the year’s biggest, with 79 million tokens distributed to early participants across its ecosystem. This included users of the testnet, holders of Bong Bear NFTs, and community builders who helped shape its early presence.

The initiative was carefully designed to reach across its user base—from technical testers to content creators—ensuring that those who contributed to Berachain’s early momentum were given meaningful rewards. This laid the groundwork for high engagement post-launch.

### **2. Kaito AI (KAITO)**

Kaito recognized the growing interest in AI-integrated blockchain platforms with a major airdrop that awarded tokens to early adopters. Eligible recipients included Genesis NFT holders, members of its social “Yaps” program, and users involved through Binance’s ecosystem.

Despite some early volatility as recipients offloaded tokens, the airdrop succeeded in building attention and onboarding thousands of new users. It split the crowd between short-term traders and long-term believers in AI’s role in Web3.

### **3. Story Protocol (IP)**

Story Protocol made a mark by rewarding those who supported its early efforts to build a decentralized framework for managing digital intellectual property. Testers, early contributors, and community participants were all included in the airdrop.

The campaign helped shape a tight-knit, mission-aligned user base focused on collaborative storytelling and rights management—positioning Story Protocol as more than just a token, but a tool for creators to reclaim ownership.

Also Read: Differences Between Blockchain Layers: Layer 1 vs. Layer 2

### **4. Solayer Labs (LAYER)**

Solayer Labs delivered a strong DeFi-focused airdrop, targeting users who interacted with synthetic assets and derivatives within its ecosystem. Active traders and liquidity providers were prioritized for rewards.

This strategy not only drove platform usage but also attracted sophisticated users likely to engage long-term. The campaign reinforced Solayer’s reputation as a go-to platform for advanced financial instruments in the crypto space.

### **5. Plume Network (PLUME)**

Plume’s airdrop gained attention with its creative format, letting users pick between a smaller, instant reward or a larger, delayed claim. Participants earned eligibility through testnet activity, faucet claims, and referrals.

The gamified structure encouraged ongoing engagement and added an element of strategy to claiming rewards, making the entire process more interactive and rewarding for users who stuck with the project.

### **6. Buzzeum (BUZZ)**

Buzzeum’s approach was highly social—users could earn tokens by completing short online tasks and referring others to the platform. With token “drops” available frequently, the campaign encouraged repeat interaction and collaboration.

The project turned airdrop farming into a competitive game, blending elements of social sharing and community building. This drove rapid user growth and created buzz (pun intended) across crypto Twitter and Telegram groups.

### **7. Nillion Network (NIL)**

Nillion Network introduced a dual airdrop strategy—allocating tokens to early testers and developers, while also opening up farming opportunities through Binance’s Launchpool. This mix attracted both technical and retail users.

The initiative struck a balance between rewarding core contributors and bringing in new faces, helping to expand the network’s reach and decentralization without sacrificing quality engagement.

Also Read: What Is a Crypto Airdrop?

### **8. Initia (INIT)**

Focusing on its modular Layer-1 and Layer-2 stack, Initia rewarded early testers and contributors who engaged with its ecosystem during the build phase. The airdrop targeted users who helped stress-test features or contributed to its development.

Rather than go for wide distribution, Initia prioritized quality over quantity—rewarding those most likely to support the network’s growth from a technical and community-building perspective.

### **9. Kamino Finance (KMNO)**

Kamino’s airdrop was based on user activity during its third incentive season. Participants who provided liquidity, staked assets, or used its leverage features on Solana were rewarded based on a points-driven model.

This approach encouraged deep engagement with the protocol’s offerings and was designed to reward consistent usage. Auto-staking mechanisms added to the appeal for long-term participants.

Also Read: What is a DEX

### 10. **BSquared Network (B2)**

BSquared took a playful and engaging route, turning its airdrop into a simulation of mining Bitcoin. Users could earn tokens through platform participation, cross-chain activity, and referrals—mirroring the rewards of mining rigs.

This mining-inspired approach fostered strong community interaction, as users competed and collaborated to boost their token earnings while supporting the project’s early adoption.

## Summary

The crypto ecosystem continues to evolve rapidly, and airdrops have become one of the most effective ways for emerging projects to generate interest and build an initial user base. By distributing free tokens, teams encourage people to explore their platforms, experiment with new functionalities, and contribute to the early stages of development. For users, this creates a risk-free entry point to discover promising projects long before they gain wider visibility.

Airdrops also stand out for their accessibility — they’re open to anyone willing to participate, whether you’re just beginning your crypto journey or already deeply involved. Still, approaching them with caution is crucial. Take time to evaluate the project’s legitimacy, goals, and team before committing your time or information.

external.description:
Table of Contents

Toggle

  * A Snapshot of 10 Notable Crypto Airdrops
    * 1. Berachain (BERA)
    * 2. Kaito AI (KAITO)
    * 3. Story Protocol (IP)
    * 4. Solayer Labs (LAYER)
    * 5. Plume Network (PLUME)
    * 6. Buzzeum (BUZZ)
    * 7. Nillion Network (NIL)
    * 8. Initia (INIT)
    * 9. Kamino Finance (KMNO)
    * 10. BSquared Network (B2)
  * Summary



Airdrops have evolved far beyond their early reputation as basic giveaway campaigns. Today, they serve as powerful catalysts for user growth, helping new projects gain traction while giving everyday users a low-barrier entry into the crypto space. By completing straightforward actions — exploring a platform, testing new tools, or sharing updates online — participants can earn tokens that may appreciate significantly as the ecosystem develops.

For builders, airdrops offer a strategic way to spotlight their projects, incentivise early involvement, and cultivate a strong, engaged user base right from the start. For users, they provide an accessible first step into digital assets, where a small initial reward can sometimes turn into substantial value.

Below are ten notable cases where early airdrop participants saw their modest token allocations grow into impressive gains.

## A Snapshot of 10 Notable Crypto Airdrops

**Token**| **Reward**| **Eligibility**
---|---|---
**Berachain (BERA)**|
~$678.7 million total| Early users, content creators & community participants via profile access.
**Kaito AI (KAITO)**|  ~$200.4 million total| Holders of Genesis NFT, program participants & Binance BNB Earn users.
**Story Protocol (IP)**|  ~$190 million total| Early testers and active community contributors.
**Solayer Labs (LAYER)**|  ~$123.6 million total| DeFi users, especially those engaging with synthetic assets.
**Plume Network (PLUME)**|  ~$112 million total| Registered participants completing testnet tasks, faucets & referrals.
**BUZZEUM (BUZZ)**|  ~$55.6 million total| Complete social media tasks and participate in the BUZZEUM community to earn entry.
**Nillion Network (NIL)**|  ~$54.5 million total| Testnet participants, community contributors, developers; Binance Launchpool supporters.
**Initia (INIT)**|  ~$37.25 million total| Early platform contributors and testers.
**Kamino Finance (KMNO)**|  ~$26.49 million total| Solana-based Season 3 stakers.
**BSquared Network (B2)**|  ~$10.5 million total| Early builders and contributors.

### **1. Berachain (BERA)**

Berachain’s airdrop stood out as one of the year’s biggest, with 79 million tokens distributed to early participants across its ecosystem. This included users of the testnet, holders of Bong Bear NFTs, and community builders who helped shape its early presence.

The initiative was carefully designed to reach across its user base—from technical testers to content creators—ensuring that those who contributed to Berachain’s early momentum were given meaningful rewards. This laid the groundwork for high engagement post-launch.

### **2. Kaito AI (KAITO)**

Kaito recognized the growing interest in AI-integrated blockchain platforms with a major airdrop that awarded tokens to early adopters. Eligible recipients included Genesis NFT holders, members of its social “Yaps” program, and users involved through Binance’s ecosystem.

Despite some early volatility as recipients offloaded tokens, the airdrop succeeded in building attention and onboarding thousands of new users. It split the crowd between short-term traders and long-term believers in AI’s role in Web3.

### **3. Story Protocol (IP)**

Story Protocol made a mark by rewarding those who supported its early efforts to build a decentralized framework for managing digital intellectual property. Testers, early contributors, and community participants were all included in the airdrop.

The campaign helped shape a tight-knit, mission-aligned user base focused on collaborative storytelling and rights management—positioning Story Protocol as more than just a token, but a tool for creators to reclaim ownership.

Also Read: Differences Between Blockchain Layers: Layer 1 vs. Layer 2

### **4. Solayer Labs (LAYER)**

Solayer Labs delivered a strong DeFi-focused airdrop, targeting users who interacted with synthetic assets and derivatives within its ecosystem. Active traders and liquidity providers were prioritized for rewards.

This strategy not only drove platform usage but also attracted sophisticated users likely to engage long-term. The campaign reinforced Solayer’s reputation as a go-to platform for advanced financial instruments in the crypto space.

### **5. Plume Network (PLUME)**

Plume’s airdrop gained attention with its creative format, letting users pick between a smaller, instant reward or a larger, delayed claim. Participants earned eligibility through testnet activity, faucet claims, and referrals.

The gamified structure encouraged ongoing engagement and added an element of strategy to claiming rewards, making the entire process more interactive and rewarding for users who stuck with the project.

### **6. Buzzeum (BUZZ)**

Buzzeum’s approach was highly social—users could earn tokens by completing short online tasks and referring others to the platform. With token “drops” available frequently, the campaign encouraged repeat interaction and collaboration.

The project turned airdrop farming into a competitive game, blending elements of social sharing and community building. This drove rapid user growth and created buzz (pun intended) across crypto Twitter and Telegram groups.

### **7. Nillion Network (NIL)**

Nillion Network introduced a dual airdrop strategy—allocating tokens to early testers and developers, while also opening up farming opportunities through Binance’s Launchpool. This mix attracted both technical and retail users.

The initiative struck a balance between rewarding core contributors and bringing in new faces, helping to expand the network’s reach and decentralization without sacrificing quality engagement.

Also Read: What Is a Crypto Airdrop?

### **8. Initia (INIT)**

Focusing on its modular Layer-1 and Layer-2 stack, Initia rewarded early testers and contributors who engaged with its ecosystem during the build phase. The airdrop targeted users who helped stress-test features or contributed to its development.

Rather than go for wide distribution, Initia prioritized quality over quantity—rewarding those most likely to support the network’s growth from a technical and community-building perspective.

### **9. Kamino Finance (KMNO)**

Kamino’s airdrop was based on user activity during its third incentive season. Participants who provided liquidity, staked assets, or used its leverage features on Solana were rewarded based on a points-driven model.

This approach encouraged deep engagement with the protocol’s offerings and was designed to reward consistent usage. Auto-staking mechanisms added to the appeal for long-term participants.

Also Read: What is a DEX

### 10. **BSquared Network (B2)**

BSquared took a playful and engaging route, turning its airdrop into a simulation of mining Bitcoin. Users could earn tokens through platform participation, cross-chain activity, and referrals—mirroring the rewards of mining rigs.

This mining-inspired approach fostered strong community interaction, as users competed and collaborated to boost their token earnings while supporting the project’s early adoption.

## Summary

The crypto ecosystem continues to evolve rapidly, and airdrops have become one of the most effective ways for emerging projects to generate interest and build an initial user base. By distributing free tokens, teams encourage people to explore their platforms, experiment with new functionalities, and contribute to the early stages of development. For users, this creates a risk-free entry point to discover promising projects long before they gain wider visibility.

Airdrops also stand out for their accessibility — they’re open to anyone willing to participate, whether you’re just beginning your crypto journey or already deeply involved. Still, approaching them with caution is crucial. Take time to evaluate the project’s legitimacy, goals, and team before committing your time or information.

external.description: İspanya’nın başkenti Madrid’deki bir mahkeme, Meta’nın kişisel verileri hukuka aykırı biçimde işleyerek haksız rekabet avantajı sağladığı gerekçesiyle 87 dijital medya kuruluşuna toplamda 479 milyon avro tazminat ödemesine hükmetti. my life is like a movie. specifically, every morning is like the scene near the end of an action movie where the nearly pulverized hero has to say “get up!” to themselves over and over before they can move.

Re: the text, which I agree with (the meme is well done but too vague), is it possible that ease of access creates an illusion that engaging grok/LLMs is inconsequential? my point being people can have fun on the internet without LLMs just like we can have fun outside without littering.
crazy movie! everything about it is nuts and it ended up being part of the fake wmd intel used to start the war in iraq. just bonkers.

Whether or not Grok searched  depends on the cleverness of its programmers. An LLM's accuracy depends on the accuracy of its search engine. This is why I think Google might win the AI wars. They've spent two decades perfecting search. So Gemini is more likely (but not guaranteed) to be true.

You need to get over the idea that an AI "believes" anything. It's just a machine for stringing words together in human-like ways. Humans say "I believe" a lot, so Grok does as well. It doesn't really "believe" anything because it's not conscious. It's just a word generator.

European policymakers scale back AI and privacy laws

Happy Friday! As the annual tech discount chaos of Black Friday (good deals and more) approaches, European policymakers have proposed easing some of the EU's strict rules on artificial intelligence and data privacy. The move aims to remove…

external.description: Happy Friday! As the annual tech discount chaos of Black Friday (good deals and more) approaches, European policymakers have proposed easing some of the EU's strict rules on artificial intelligence and data privacy. The move aims to remove barriers to tech companies and encourage business growth in the region, potentially marking a major pivot away from the bloc's reputation as the industry's toughest regulator. The changes will allow AI companies to access shared personal data to train their models, as well as changes to GDPR cookie rules. Instead of constant pop-ups, users can set preferences once in their browser and consent with one click.
external.title: European policymakers scale back AI and privacy laws

record.text:
Hundreds of English-language websites link to pro-Kremlin propaganda | Russia

Hundreds of English-language websites – ranging from mainstream news outlets to fringe blogs – are spreading disinformation on the Internet by linking to articles from pro-Kremlin networks, according to a study released…

external.description: Hundreds of English-language websites – ranging from mainstream news outlets to fringe blogs – are spreading disinformation on the Internet by linking to articles from pro-Kremlin networks, according to a study released by a London-based think tank. The Institute for Strategic Dialogue (ISD) study found that in more than 80% of the citations analyzed, websites treated the network as a credible source, legitimizing its narratives and increasing its visibility. The disinformation operation – known as the Pravda Network – was identified by the French government last year. The ISD warned that by linking to articles in the network, websites were inadvertently increasing the chances of appearing on search engines and large language model (LLM) pages, even in cases where the linking sites were disputing the Pravda Network as the source.
external.title: Hundreds of English-language websites link to pro-Kremlin propaganda | Russia

AI as Cyberattacker

external.description: From Anthropic: In mid-September 2025, we detected suspicious activity that later investigation determined to be a highly sophisticated espionage campaign. The attackers used AI’s “agentic” capabilities to an unprecedented degree­—using AI not just as an advisor, but to execute the cyberattacks themselves. The threat actor—­whom we assess with high confidence was a Chinese state-sponsored group—­manipulated our Claude Code tool into attempting infiltration into roughly thirty global targets and succeeded in a small number of cases. The operation targeted large tech companies, financial institutions, chemical manufacturing companies, and government agencies. We believe this is the first documented case of a large-scale cyberattack executed without substantial human intervention...
external.title: AI as Cyberattacker - Schneier on Security

record.text:
J M Keynes built his theoretical structure on the insight that the future is unknowable. A premise it is hard to argue with.
Bloomberg seems to be saying that it has knowledge of an alternative future to the one we actually lived in.
If all forecasts are wrong, what chance for alternative realities?

“The EU relies on open international markets to absorb its trade surpluses.”
“Instead of exporting capital globally, it needs to deploy more in Europe.”

These are two sides of the same coin. But is the EU willing to reduce it trade surpluses?
I do wonder!
Can't blame AI totally, here, as it was plain old Google that I used to check. So Google, even if you deliberately choose not to use AI, is relying on it whether you want it to or not.

Magnetic North wanders around anyway.
😉👍

Not new for those who follow AI discussion, but the recent announcement that Le Cun is leaving Meta for a new startup seem to be the start of the next new AI narrative: spatial or world models as a replacement to LLMs. Sorta hybrid return to symbolic AI. Bet we start seeing more and more of this.

	But LeCun thinks LLMs are reaching their limits. Instead, as he noted in a 2022 paper, he now favours “world models”, which use an approach to sorting information that is inspired by how humans learn. “LLMs are great, they’re useful, we should invest in them — a lot of people are going to use them,” he said this month. “[But] they are not a path to human-level intelligence . . . so for the next revolution, we need to take a step back.”

	The tech behemoth IBM says it is developing variants of so-called neuro-symbolic AI. “By augmenting and combining the strengths of statistical AI, like machine learning, with the capabilities of humanlike symbolic knowledge and reasoning, we’re aiming to create a revolution in AI, rather than an evolution,” it explains.

Chinese and western researchers are also exploring variants of neuro-symbolic AI while Fei-Fei Li, the so-called “Godmother of AI”, is developing a world model version called “spatial intelligence”.

へぇ…　ママンゴってやっぱり強いよねぇ　バリバリついてってるじゃん　＞ＡＩマンガ

俺は医療の方急いで欲しいんだけども…（ＡＩに）

#サナエノミクス #日本 #政治

「石破より借金少なくする」

…サナエリプライ聽き𡆥か？
サナエといえば日本を滅ぼすアベノミクスの継続拡張

ですが、財務大臣が山本太郎でなく2025春円安に不満の片山さつき
で、違和感バリバリだったのですが…

先程サナエ自身が日本人に向け、
昨年度42.1兆円より国債を少なくする
と明言致仕𡆥…

以上を受け急に円髙に…コレでは日本を救ってしまう……

しかし…サナエを応援してるネトウヨは
日本を滅ぼすコトを熱望してゐる…

今は騙せて〼が…いつまで欺ける而侯歟呢……？

…父の兄弟の葬式終わり𡆥…

はぁ…

１万歳にもなってない若造が…
